keyword: calories in a white chocolate mocha from starbucks
title: Calories in a White Chocolate Mocha from Starbucks
meta_description: Discover calories in a white chocolate mocha from Starbucks, including full nutrition breakdown for a Grande size, macros, and customization tips.
h1: Calories in a White Chocolate Mocha from Starbucks
assumptions: Grande (16 oz) size, made with 2% milk, 2 shots espresso, white mocha syrup, no whipped cream or modifications.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, milk type, syrup amount, and customizations; values based on Starbucks standard recipe—check app or receipt for exacts.

quick_answer.text: A Grande White Chocolate Mocha from Starbucks has about 430 calories and 10 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a Grande White Chocolate Mocha from Starbucks?
faqs.a: About 430 calories for the standard 2% milk version.

faqs.q: What are the sugars in a white chocolate mocha from Starbucks?
faqs.a: Approximately 58 g of sugars, mostly from the mocha syrup.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie white chocolate mocha from Starbucks?
faqs.a: Yes, opt for nonfat milk and sugar-free syrup to drop to around 200-300 kcal.

faqs.q: How much caffeine in a white chocolate mocha from Starbucks?
faqs.a: About 150 mg from 2 shots of espresso in a Grande size.

faqs.q: Does milk type affect calories in a white chocolate mocha from Starbucks?
faqs.a: Yes—nonfat reduces by ~100 kcal, whole milk adds ~50 kcal versus 2%.
